narratives.title: The Ongoing Massacre
narratives.description: Documenting the regime's mass killings, executions, hospital raids, and chemical weapons use
keyFacts: Chemical weapons used in Tehran, Mashhad
narratives.tweetAngle: Document the death toll, name the crime as genocide, never let the world forget

narratives.title: Digital Blackout & Starlink Lifeline
narratives.description: Regime's attempt to hide massacre through internet blackout, and how Starlink is breaking through
narratives.tweetAngle: Technology vs tyranny - truth finding a way despite regime's efforts

narratives.title: Trump vs Khamenei Twitter War
narratives.description: The back-and-forth between Trump and Khamenei on social media as regime crumbles
keyFacts: Trump responding with threats and support for people
Khamenei reportedly in eastern Iran bunker
narratives.tweetAngle: Regime desperate - hiding in bunker while talking tough on Twitter

narratives.title: Crown Prince Pahlavi Emerges as Leader
narratives.description: The Crown Prince's role coordinating protests, strikes, and serving as interim leader candidate
keyFacts: 'Javid Shah' chants in streets across Iran
narratives.tweetAngle: Opposition coalescing around legitimate heir - people choosing their future

narratives.title: Khamenei's Fate - Bunker, Russia, or Death?
narratives.persianTitle: سرنوشت خامنه‌ای - پناهگاه، روسیه یا مرگ
narratives.description: Speculation and reports about what will happen to the Supreme Leader
keyFacts: Reports of bunker in eastern Iran
Counter-narrative: will go down with the ship
narratives.tweetAngle: Rat fleeing sinking ship, or captain going down? Either way, end is near

narratives.title: Western Hypocrites' Deafening Silence
narratives.description: Documenting how Western 'progressives' who loudly condemned Israel are silent on Iran's massacre
keyFacts: Greenwald: extensive Gaza coverage, zero Iran
Hasan Piker: daily Israel content, no Iran
Roger Waters: concerts against Israel, silent on Iran
narratives.tweetAngle: Not whataboutism - exposing selective humanity. Where are the 'humanitarians' now?

narratives.title: Diaspora Under Attack, Standing Strong
narratives.persianTitle: حمله به دیاسپورا، مقاومت ادامه دارد
narratives.description: Iranian diaspora protests worldwide and regime attempts to silence them
keyFacts: Solidarity protests in major cities globally
narratives.tweetAngle: Regime's long arm can't stop diaspora courage

narratives.title: History Repeating - Will the West Act?
narratives.persianTitle: تکرار تاریخ - آیا غرب عمل خواهد کرد
narratives.description: Connecting current events to historical patterns of Western betrayal
keyFacts: 2022: Biden silent on Woman Life Freedom
narratives.tweetAngle: Pattern of betrayal - will this time be different?

narratives.title: The Fire Parallel: 1978 vs 2026
narratives.description: Cinema Rex (1978) and Rasht Bazaar (2026) - same regime, same tactics, same lies
keyFacts: 1978: Islamists burned 400 alive at Cinema Rex, blamed Shah
2026: Regime burned protesters at Rasht Bazaar, blamed 'rioters'
narratives.tweetAngle: 1978: They burned 400 alive and blamed the Shah. 2026: Same people burn protesters and blame 'rioters'. Same regime, same tactics.

narratives.title: Gulf States Fear Free Iran More Than Mullahs
narratives.persianTitle: دولت‌های خلیج از ایران آزاد بیشتر می‌ترسند
narratives.description: Why Saudi Arabia, Qatar, and other Gulf states are silent as Iran massacres its people
keyFacts: Gulf states lobbying Washington to avoid action
Fear of democratic Iran as regional competitor
89M educated population would dwarf Gulf economies
MBS and Greenwald agree on silence
narratives.tweetAngle: Saudi spent billions fighting Iranian proxies. Now silent as Iran massacres its own. They don't want freedom - they want a weak Iran.

narratives.title: Revolution Must Come From Within
narratives.description: Iran's geography makes invasion impossible - that's why this revolution must be internal
keyFacts: Zagros mountains, central deserts protect from invasion
Every conqueror in 800 years was absorbed
narratives.tweetAngle: Last invasion: 1220. Mountains, deserts, 89M people. That's why this revolution comes from WITHIN. And it is.

narratives.title: Iran Won't Become Yugoslavia
narratives.description: Despite ethnic diversity, Iranians are united - 2,500 years of shared identity doesn't break
keyFacts: Khuzestan Arabs didn't join Iraqi invasion
90% Shia - religious unity crosses ethnic lines
narratives.tweetAngle: Kurds, Azeris, Baluch, Arabs, Persians - all chanting the same thing: Death to Khamenei. 2,500 years of unity doesn't break.

narratives.title: 47 Years in Exile - Now Called Home
narratives.persianTitle: ۴۷ سال در تبعید - حالا فراخوانده می‌شود
narratives.description: Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi's journey from exile to leading opposition voice
keyFacts: Left Iran 1978 at age 17, never returned
Father died 1980, only Sadat gave asylum
narratives.tweetAngle: For 47 years the Crown Prince waited. Now the people are calling him home. History completing its circle.

narratives.title: Client to None: Iran's Great Power Reset
narratives.persianTitle: وابسته به هیچ‌کس: بازنشانی قدرت بزرگ ایران
narratives.description: Under mullahs, Iran became junior partner to China/Russia. A free Iran will be partner to all, client to none.
keyFacts: Treaty of Turkmenchay 1828 - Russia took Caucasus
Silk Road: Persia and China were equals for 2,000 years
narratives.tweetAngle: The mullahs sold Iran to China and Russia because they had no choice. Democratic Iran will have choices. Partner to all, client to none.

narratives.title: Iran Isn't Iraq - This Is Different
narratives.persianTitle: ایران عراق نیست - این فرق دارد
narratives.description: Countering the 'remember Iraq' narrative - Iran has democratic history, educated population, no neighbor saboteur
keyFacts: Iran Constitutional Revolution 1906 - first in Islamic world
Iran sabotaged Iraq for 20 years - no one can sabotage Iran
narratives.tweetAngle: 'Remember Iraq!' is a false binary. Iran has 120 years of democratic memory, 97% literacy, and no neighbor can sabotage it. Different situation entirely.

narratives.title: 120 Years of Constitutional Memory
narratives.description: Iran's 1906 Constitutional Revolution predates Turkey - Iranians have deep democratic tradition
keyFacts: 1906 Constitutional Revolution - FIRST in Islamic world
narratives.tweetAngle: 1906: Constitutional Revolution. 1951: Mossadegh elected. 2026: Finishing what they started. This isn't 'regime change' - it's regime RESTORATION.

narratives.title: The MEK: Traitors Cashing In
narratives.description: MEK sided with Saddam, killed Americans, now pays US politicians millions to pretend they represent Iran
keyFacts: Sided with Saddam during Iran-Iraq war
Zero support inside Iran - viewed as traitors (Monafeghin)
narratives.tweetAngle: MEK sided with Saddam when he gassed Iranians. Now they pay American politicians millions to pretend they represent Iran. They don't. Iranians call them 'Monafeghin' - hypocrites.

narratives.title: The Iran Lobby in Washington
narratives.description: NIAC, Trita Parsi, and the network whitewashing regime crimes in DC
keyFacts: Federal judge: NIAC work 'not inconsistent' with regime lobbying
NIAC lost suit, paid $180K, withheld 5,500 emails
'NIAC' is now a slur in Iran
Iran Foreign Ministry ran 'Iran Experts Initiative'
narratives.tweetAngle: A US federal judge ruled NIAC's work was 'not inconsistent with lobbying for the regime.' 'NIAC' is now a slur in Iran. Follow the money.

narratives.title: Ayatollah BBC: Media That Failed Iran
narratives.persianTitle: آیت‌الله بی‌بی‌سی: رسانه‌هایی که ایران را ناامید کردند
narratives.description: BBC Persian, VOA, and media that tilt toward regime or MEK over legitimate opposition
keyFacts: Near-total silence on Iran vs Gaza coverage
narratives.tweetAngle: Iranians have a name for BBC Persian: 'Ayatollah BBC.' When the world's biggest democracy movement needs coverage, they obsess over Gaza. Not a coincidence.

narratives.title: The Rial's Collapse: 47 Years of Theft
narratives.description: Economic disaster while regime spends billions on proxies and Khamenei hoards $200B
keyFacts: Billions to Hezbollah while Iranians starve
narratives.tweetAngle: Under the Shah, 1 USD = 70 rials. Today: 1 USD = 700,000+ rials. 47 years of theft. Billions to Hezbollah while Iranians can't afford bread.

guidelines.historicalContextFrequency: When illuminating, not as primary content
